original: “Products ” means the products listed in Schedule 1 .
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Products' shall encompass those items as detailed in Schedule 1 , however, excluding any that may be subject to subsequent modification or removal."

This revision suggests that the Products in question will primarily consist of those listed in Schedule 1. However, it also implies that there may be instances where certain products are not included due to potential modifications or removals. This could potentially weaken the obligation to include all items from Schedule 1 as 'Products'.

original: “Software ” means Supplier’s proprietary software components, included as part of the Products, including all improvements, corrections, updates, upgrades and any related documentation and derivatives thereof.
ollama_generated: "The term 'Software' encompasses the supplier-owned proprietary software elements embedded within the Products, comprising enhancements, rectifications, revisions, and advancements, as well as any associated documentation and byproducts derived therefrom. However, it is explicitly noted that the client assumes responsibility for maintaining, updating, and upgrading the Software independently, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement."

original: “Territory ” means the countries and/or territories listed in Schedule 1 .
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Territory' encompasses any country or territory that may be added to, or excluded from, Schedule 1 as per the discretion of the Party of primary jurisdiction."

This revision slightly alters the original clause by shifting responsibility for additions and exclusions to the countries/territories listed in Schedule 1 to the Party of primary jurisdiction. This means that the territory covered can change dynamically, depending on decisions made by the Party of primary jurisdiction.

original: Source: HEALTHCARE INTEGRATED TECHNOLOGIES INC., 8-K, 8/12/2019 Diagnostics, Telemetric Data and Analytics. Supplier will retain access to diagnostics, telemetric data and analytics generated by the Product. The data shall be uploaded to Supplier’s Firebase server in a timely manner. A server interface will be embedded within the software package provided by the Supplier. Distributor will maintain Supplier’s interface to the server and access to such data within the Product; provided that the data and analytics to be received by the Supplier shall, in all cases, not be in violation of any applicable privacy or other law.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: HEALTHCARE INTEGRATED TECHNOLOGIES INC., 8-K, 8/12/2019 Diagnostics, Telemetric Data and Analytics. The Distributor shall be responsible for maintaining the access to diagnostics, telemetric data and analytics generated by the Product within the Product, which shall be uploaded to the Supplier's Firebase server in a timely manner. A software interface provided by the Distributor will be utilized for this purpose. The Supplier acknowledges that it shall not be responsible for maintaining the interface or access to such data and is only entitled to receive data and analytics that do not violate any applicable privacy or other law.

original: Orders, Payment and Delivery If Reseller fails to submit Orders with an aggregate value equal to or greater than the MOQ, then Reseller shall pay Supplier a sum equal to the shortfall, within 30 days after the end of the Initial Term. Upon payment of such amount, Seller shall deliver the Products paid for to Reseller in a commercially reasonable timeframe (and in no event any later than 150 days from the date such payment is received in full) to be sold by Reseller in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated by the last sentence of Section 12.4.
ollama_generated: Orders, Payment, and Delivery: In case the aggregate value of Orders placed by the Reseller falls below the Minimum Order Quantity (MOQ), the Supplier shall be obliged to supply the difference at a discounted rate, effective 30 days after the conclusion of the Initial Term. Upon receipt of such reduced payment, the Supplier will deliver the Products within a commercially reasonable timeframe, though in no case earlier than 150 days from the date of payment. The Reseller is then at liberty to sell these products as per this Agreement, detailed in Section 12.4's concluding sentence.

original: Within 5 business days following the receipt of each Order, Supplier shall acknowledge receipt of such Order. No Order shall be binding upon Supplier until such written acknowledgment was sent by Supplier to Reseller; provided that Supplier shall confirm or reject such Orders at its discretion.
ollama_generated: Within 5 business days following the receipt of each Order, Supplier retains the right, but not the obligation, to acknowledge receipt of such Order. An Order will only become binding upon Supplier after the lapse of a reasonable period, should no rejection or non-confirmation be communicated by the Supplier to the Reseller. In the event that the Supplier chooses not to acknowledge an Order, it shall have no further obligations related to such Order.

original: Defective Products; Warranty; Support During the Term Supplier may extend an offer to Reseller for a Returns Discount Program, whereby the Supplier will rebate a percentage of the cost of goods sold in lieu of accepting End-User returns. In the event no Returns Discount Program has been entered into by the Parties, Supplier will not accept Returned Product, except for cases of Defective Products.
ollama_generated: Defective Products and Warranty; Support During the Term: The Reseller is offered a possibility to participate in a Returns Rebate Program, at the discretion of the Supplier. Under this program, the Supplier will provide a rebate for a specified percentage of the cost of goods sold as an alternative to accepting End-User returns. In the absence of a signed agreement on the Returns Rebate Program, the Reseller shall bear responsibility for handling and disposing of Returned Products, except in instances where the product is identified as Defective. The Supplier assumes no obligation to accept or inspect any returned items unless they are confirmed as Defective.

original: Reseller shall: (a) not do or omit to do, nor authorize any third party to do or omit to do, any act or omission that would or might invalidate or be inconsistent with any of Supplier’s intellectual property rights; (b) promptly notify Supplier of any actual, threatened, or suspected infringement of any of Supplier’s intellectual property rights that comes to Reseller’s notice; and (c) at Supplier’s request and expense, do all such things as may be reasonably required to assist Supplier in taking or resisting any proceedings in relation to any such infringement or claim.
ollama_generated:
Licensee shall avoid and refrain from performing or failing to perform, or from permitting any third party to perform or fail to perform, any action that could potentially conflict with or undermine Licensor's intellectual property rights. (a) Upon discovery of any potential, alleged, or suspected infringement of Licensor's intellectual property rights, Licensee shall promptly inform Licensor without undue delay. (b) In response to a request from Licensor and at Licensor's sole expense, Licensee agrees to cooperate in carrying out all reasonable actions required to aid Licensor in managing or defending against any such infringement or claim.

The changes made in this clause are as follows:
- Changed "Reseller" to "Licensee" and "Supplier" to "Licensor."
- Reversed the obligation from Reseller/Licensee to promptly notify Supplier/Licensor, to Licensor to be informed by Reseller/Licensee upon discovery of any potential infringement.
- Made it clear that Licensee's cooperation and actions in relation to intellectual property infringements are at the expense of Licensor.

original: No failure or delay on the part of either Party to exercise any right or remedy under this Agreement shall be construed or operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any right or remedy preclude the further exercise of such right or remedy.
ollama_generated: Any forbearance by either Party in exercising rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be considered as a waiver of those rights or remedies, and the failure to act in relation to one particular right or remedy shall not restrict or limit the ability to enforce other rights or remedies.

original: All notices or other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be given in person, by courier or by registered mail (provided that written confirmation of receipt is provided) addressed as set forth in the heading of this Agreement or such other address as any Party may designate to the other in accordance with this procedure. All communications delivered in person or by courier service shall be deemed to have been received upon delivery, shall be deemed to have been received on the business day following transmission with confirmed answer back, and all notices and other communications sent by registered mail shall be deemed to have been received within 3 business days after posting.
ollama_generated: All communications or notifications related to this agreement shall be made in writing, either delivered in person, via a recognized courier service, or by registered email (as long as an automatic read receipt is generated). Deliveries made in person or through a courier will be considered received upon delivery. Communication sent via courier will be deemed received on the business day after it has been transmitted and acknowledged. Communications sent by registered email shall be deemed received within two business days following its transmission. Any Party may designate a new address for such communications at any time in accordance with this procedure.

original: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of New York and all disputes and controversies arising out of or in connection with the Agreement shall be brought exclusively before the competent courts in New York County, New York; provided however that judgment shall be enforceable in any country and that nothing in this Section shall prevent or restrict either Party from seeking interim relief in any competent jurisdiction as it may deem fit.
ollama_generated: This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of New York, with any disputes or controversies arising herefrom resolved exclusively within the jurisdiction of courts located in New York County, New York. Notwithstanding this provision, each Party retains the right to pursue interim relief in any competent jurisdiction it deems necessary. Moreover, both Parties acknowledge and agree that any judgment rendered shall be enforceable in any country, with no provisions herein intended to limit or impede such enforceability.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated:
FOR THE RECORD, the Parties acknowledge their signing of this Agreement on the Stated Effective Date.

In this revised clause, I've shifted the tone slightly to be less formal and more concise, while still maintaining professionalism. The original clause states that the parties have executed the agreement as of a specific date, which is factual and unequivocal. In the new version, I've used "for the record" to acknowledge the signing, but it does not explicitly state that they have done so at the stated effective date, leaving room for some potential ambiguity or flexibility in interpretation.
